# Amalku Project - Copilot Instructions

## Project Overview
Amalku is a Ramadhan family ibadah tracker web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase.

## Tech Stack
- **Frontend**: Next.js 14 (App Router), TypeScript, Tailwind CSS
- **Backend & Auth**: Supabase (Authentication, Database, Real-time)
- **Hosting**: Vercel

## Project Status
- [x] Copilot instructions created
- [x] Project scaffolded
- [x] Supabase configured
- [x] Project structure created
- [x] Dependencies installed
- [x] Development environment ready

## Project Structure
- `src/app/` - Next.js App Router pages
- `src/components/` - React components
- `src/lib/supabase/` - Supabase client utilities
- `src/types/` - TypeScript type definitions
- `supabase/` - Database schema and migrations

## Development Commands
- `npm run dev` - Start development server
- `npm run build` - Build for production
- `npm run start` - Start production server  
- `npm run lint` - Run ESLint

## Environment Setup
1. Copy `.env.example` to `.env.local`
2. Fill in Supabase credentials from your Supabase dashboard
3. Run `supabase/schema.sql` in Supabase SQL Editor
